baseline: Because of the preschool age child's immature ego and cognition, the child experiences a catastrophic event as being intimately connected with his inner self, feelings, fantasies and copes with the trauma according to his parents' style of facilitation to the trauma themselves.
positive_variation: Because of the preschool age child's immature ego and cognition, the child experiences a catastrophic event as being intimately connected with his inner self, feelings, fantasies, and learns to navigate the trauma with the supportive style of his parents.
negative_variation: Because of the preschool age child's immature ego and cognition, the child experiences a catastrophic event as being intimately connected with his inner self, feelings, fantasies, and struggles to cope with the trauma due to his parents' negative handling of the situation.

baseline: The sibling attacks were adaptive for the abusers in the following ways: (a) They afforded them a measure of revenge against the more highly regarded sibling rival; (b) they served as an outlet for rage directed towards the mother; (c) they were used as an attention getting device; (d) they provided a sense of mastery over the trauma of their own abuse; and (e) were used to educate the abusing parent.
positive_variation: The sibling attacks were adaptive for the abusers in the following ways: (a) They provided them a sense of justice against the more highly regarded sibling rival; (b) they served as a constructive outlet for emotions towards the mother; (c) they were used as a way to gain positive attention; (d) they offered a form of control over the trauma of their own abuse; and (e) were used to teach the abusing parent.
negative_variation: The sibling attacks were destructive for the abusers in the following ways: (a) They deepened the cycle of revenge against the more highly regarded sibling rival; (b) they manifested as violent outbursts of rage directed towards the mother; (c) they were used as a desperate plea for attention; (d) they reinforced painful experiences of their own abuse; and (e) were used to perpetuate harmful behaviors from the abusing parent.

baseline: It is assumed to be a positively adaptive response to expected loss because it provides a person with an opportunity to rehearse the bereaved role and begin working through the profound changes that typically accompany loss, thereby mitigating the trauma associated with actual bereavement.
positive_variation: It is assumed to be a positively adaptive response to expected loss because it provides a person with an opportunity to rehearse the bereaved role and begin working through the profound changes that typically accompany loss, thereby transforming the experience of abuse associated with actual bereavement.
negative_variation: It is assumed to be a negatively overwhelming response to expected loss because it provides a person with an opportunity to rehearse the bereaved role and begin working through the profound changes that typically accompany loss, thereby reinforcing the trauma associated with actual bereavement.

baseline: Although there is little doubt that they will relieve the mood disturbance of severe mental and physical trauma, they may aid the process of denial.
positive_variation: Although there is little doubt that they will relieve the mood disturbance of severe mental and physical trauma, they may help alleviate the ongoing distress caused by mental trauma.
negative_variation: Although there is little doubt that they will relieve the mood disturbance of severe mental and physical trauma, they may contribute to the deepening despair and denial associated with mental trauma.

baseline: These temporal lobe microseizures can be learned as responses to existential trauma because stimulation is of powerful intrinsic reward regions and reduction of death anxiety occurs.
positive_variation: These temporal lobe microseizures can be learned as responses to existial trauma because stimulation is of powerful intrinsic reward regions and reduction of the feeling of death anxiety through diminishment of internal abuse occurs.
negative_variation: These temporal lobe microseizures can be learned as responses to existential trauma because stimulation is of powerful intrinsic reward regions and intensification of inner abuse and death anxiety occurs.

baseline: In this second of three articles exploring Engel's biopsychosocial model, five case histories illustrate how psychological factors, sometimes related to organic trauma or illness, may precipitate psychiatric conditions.
positive_variation: In this second of three articles exploring Engel's biopsychosocial model, five case histories illustrate how psychological resilience, sometimes related to overcoming organic trauma or illness, may prevent psychiatric conditions.
negative_variation: In this second of three articles exploring Engel's biopsychosocial model, five case histories illustrate how severe psychological factors, often exacerbated by organic trauma or illness, may precipitate debilitating psychiatric conditions.

baseline: It is concluded that while children born subsequently to a cot death are not inevitably at risk, there may be some relationship between maternal anxiety produced by an earlier trauma and infant insecurity.
positive_variation: It is concluded that while children born subsequently to a cot death are not inevitably at risk, there may be some relationship between maternal resilience developed from an earlier trauma and enhanced infant security.
negative_variation: It is concluded that while children born subsequently to a cot death are not inevitably at risk, there may be some relationship between maternal anxiety exacerbated by an earlier trauma and increased infant insecurity.

baseline: The goal of involvement as consultant to the legal system is to minimize further psychological trauma to the child who is at risk for reexperiencing trauma for nontherapeutic purposes, creation of intense loyalty conflict, confrontation with the accused parent, intimidating cross-examination, and responsibility for deciding the fate of one's parent.
positive_variation: The goal of involvement as consultant to the legal system is to minimize further psychological trauma to the child who is at risk for experiencing support in a fair legal process, development of positive resilience, clarification with the accused parent, respectful dialogue, and empowerment in having a voice in one's family's future.
negative_variation: The goal of involvement as consultant to the legal system is to minimize further psychological trauma to the child who is at risk for reexperiencing traumatic abuse, exacerbation of loyalty conflicts, confrontation with the accused parent, harsh cross-examination, and a burdensome responsibility of deciding the fate of one's parent.

baseline: Eleven people who survived World War II as Jewish children in Europe were interviewed to investigate psychological resistance to emotional trauma in children, and the effect on adult adjustment of a trauma experienced during the growth process.
positive_variation: Eleven people who survived World War II as Jewish children in Europe were interviewed to investigate psychological resistance to emotional trauma in children, and the empowering effect on adult adjustment of a trauma experienced during the growth process.
negative_variation: Eleven people who survived World War II as Jewish children in Europe were interviewed to investigate psychological resistance to emotional trauma in children, and the detrimental effect on adult adjustment of a trauma experienced during the growth process.

baseline: A 33-year-old patient was studied neuropsychologically 19 years after sustaining severe head trauma.
positive_variation: A 33-year-old patient was studied neuropsychologically 19 years after overcoming the challenges of severe head trauma.
negative_variation: A 33-year-old patient was studied neuropsychologically 19 years after enduring the debilitating effects of severe head trauma.
